item.title: Engineering the Hyperloop prototype
item.author: Osama Awara,
item.description: It was in 2012 that the restless entrepreneur Elon Musk first announced his idea for a high speed transport system – the Hyperloop. item.title: The art of war for faceless people
item.author: Osama Awara,
item.description: The previous few weeks have seen a surge in cyber warfare like no other. From the Sony Pictures hacking over The Interview – a satire film depicting the assassination attempt of Kim Jong-Un, to the ISIS hacking of US Central Command Twitter account. The hacktivist group Anonymous have vowed to take …

item.title: Microsoft hope 3 is the magic number
item.author: Osama Awara,
item.description: The third generation of Windows tablets, or Lablets as I like to call them, have been released by Microsoft. They claim that the Surface Pro 3 is not only a tablet, but a laptop as well, potentially replacing both of those devices in your home. After owning one for several weeks, I can honestly back …

item.title: Future of Social Media
item.author: Osama Awara,
item.description: When you hear the term social media, what comes to mind? Facebook? Twitter? Or perhaps even that embarrassing video you were tagged in by your friends last night. Of the modern age of technology, social media has perhaps had the most profound effect on our lives, reaching out with its addictive grip …

item.title: Consumer Electronics Show

item.description: The Consumer Electronics Show (CES) is an annual technology and consumer products show held every January in Las Vegas. Being the global stage that attracts next generation innovations and electronics, CES is the largest of its kind, showcasing over 3000 exhibitors from computer hardware …

item.title: Tech for X-Mas

item.description: Samsung KN55S9C OLED TV If you’ve ever thought that HD pictures were not enough, fear no more, the Samsung OLED TV that uses organic self-emitting pixels would blow your mind away this Christmas giving you the best quality, surpassing even the best LCD TVs. item.title: 5 Things Consoles are killing

item.description: Many Potential PC Gamers The great thing about consoles is their price relative to gaming PC rigs. item.title: 10 things the internet has slaughtered
item.author: Osama Awara,
item.description: 1. Movie Stores Long gone are the days of popping in to your local Blockbusters and buying that VHS tape or DVD that had you sorted for the night. item.title: Cyber black market is no more
item.author: Osama Awara,
item.description: Known and loved by its many users and advocates as the Silk Road Marketplace, this underground website dubbed as the ‘amazon.com’ and ‘e-bay’ of illegal drugs has officially been shut down by the FBI. Seizing what is believed to be $3.6 million dollars in bitcoins, a small fraction of their $80 …

item.title: NSA: Peeling the skin off TOR users
item.author: Osama Awara,
item.description: The NSA known for its privacy breaching of internet users across the globe has been found ‘peeling’ the encryption that Tor provides for its users’ information sent online, in order to gain access to sensitive information. Tor is a piece of software, ironically funded by the US government, which …

item.title: 3-D Printers take off!
item.author: Osama Awara,
item.description: Launching a rocket into space is in itself a tricky business; well after all it is rocket science!
